thread.title: Stephen King wraps up crime fiction trilogy with novel 'End of Watch,' scheduled for next June
thread.title_full: Stephen King wraps up crime fiction trilogy with novel 'End of Watch,' scheduled for next June

title: Stephen King wraps up crime fiction trilogy with novel 'End of Watch,' scheduled for next June
text:
Stephen King wraps up crime fiction trilogy with novel 'End of Watch,' scheduled for next June THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   08, 2015 - 12:55 pmLast Updated: October 08, 2015 - 12:56 pm   
Subjects: Arts and entertainment (1849) 
NEW YORK â€” The end is near for Stephen King's Bill Hodges trilogy, his foray into crime fiction. 
King's "End of Watch" will be published next June, Scribner announced Thursday. The novel is the third, after "Mr. Mercedes" and "Finders Keepers," to feature retired police detective Bill Hodges. "End of Watch" will feature another recurring character, Mercedes killer Brady Hartsfield, and his extraordinary powers even as he lies in a vegetative state. 
According to Scribner, "End of Watch" will bring the series to a "sublimely terrifying conclusion," as King combines crime fiction with the supernatural. 
Online:
